name: McDaniel Learning Center
description: McDaniel Learning Center is an alternative high school serving students in grades 9-12 in the Laurel County School District. The center provides specialized educational programs for students who may benefit from alternative learning environments, offering personalized instruction and support services. The school serves 37 students with a student-teacher ratio of 9.25:1, providing individualized attention and flexible learning options to help students achieve academic success.
source: Verified from official school website, NCES database, and Google Business listing
services: Alternative high school education, grades 9-12, personalized instruction, alternative learning programs, special education services, free/reduced lunch programs
eligibility: High school students in grades 9-12 seeking alternative educational options
fees: Free public education, some fees may apply for special programs
